headline: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Accenture, Gartner Stocks Pressured by Government Spending Cuts
summary: The S&P 500 slipped 0.2% on Thursday, March 20, 2025, reversing a portion of the previous day's uptick as investors further digested the Fed's latest rate announcement.

raw.headline: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Accenture, Gartner Stocks Pressured by Government Spending Cuts
raw.summary: The S&P 500 slipped 0.2% on Thursday, March 20, 2025, reversing a portion of the previous day's uptick as investors further digested the Fed's latest rate announcement.

headline: Why Microchip Technology (MCHP) Shares Are Trading Lower Today
summary: Shares of analog chipmaker Microchip Technology (NASDAQ:MCHP) fell 7% in the pre-market session after the company announced it was raising roughly $1.35 billion in convertible debt. The stock likely fell due to concerns about the dilutive effect of the debt, which can be converted to the company's ordinary stock, raising the total share count.

raw.headline: Why Microchip Technology (MCHP) Shares Are Trading Lower Today

headline: Microchip Technology Moves to Sell Facility, Launches $1.35B Stock Offering
summary: Struggling Microchip Technology announced it has brought in Macquarie Group to facilitate the sale of its manufacturing facility in Tempe, Ariz., and that it has launched a $1.35 billion convertible stock offering.

raw.headline: Microchip Technology Moves to Sell Facility, Launches $1.35B Stock Offering
raw.summary: Struggling Microchip Technology announced it has brought in Macquarie Group to facilitate the sale of its manufacturing facility in Tempe, Ariz., and that it has launched a $1.35 billion convertible stock offering.

headline: Microchip Technology Engages Macquarie Group to Facilitate Sale of Tempe Fab 2 Wafer Fabrication Facility
summary: CHANDLER, Ariz., March 20, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Microchip Technology (Nasdaq: MCHP) today announced it has engaged Macquarie Group to oversee the marketing and sale of its wafer fabrication facility (“Fab 2”) located in Tempe, Arizona. This decision is part of Microchip's previously announced manufacturing restructuring plan supporting its strategic goal of enhancing operational efficiency and profitability.
